headline: This Staid Dividend ETF Is Already Up 10% in 2026. Caterpillar Leads the Charge.
summary: In 2026, the bet is finally paying off—with stalwarts like  Caterpillar Exxon Mobil  and  Clorox  posting 25%-plus returns.  It’s been a tough stretch for so-called dividend aristocrats, stocks known for decades of consistent payouts.  With investors suddenly jittery over software and other tech stocks, the script has flipped.

headline: Q2 Deep Dive: Evaluating Clorox's Financial and Operating Metrics
summary: CLX posts mixed Q2 as sales beat but earnings miss, with International and Health & Wellness strength offset by Household and Lifestyle weakness.

headline: A Look At Clorox’s Valuation After A Mixed Quarter And Ongoing ERP And Promotion Headwinds
summary: Clorox (CLX) is back in focus after a mixed recent quarter, where revenue edged lower year over year but still topped Wall Street expectations and highlighted ongoing pressure from ERP rollout issues and heavier promotions. See our latest analysis for Clorox. That mixed quarter and the ongoing ERP and promotion headwinds are arriving against a backdrop of strong short term momentum, with a 30 day share price return of 17.73% and year to date share price return of 24.89%. However, the 1 year...

headline: P&G Rallies Under New CEO but Lags Rivals, Faces Tariff Challenges
summary: Procter & Gamble (NYSE: PG) stock has climbed 11.65% year-to-date as of February 11, 2026, reaching $160 per share from a year-end close of $142.31. That gain looks impressive until you examine the broader consumer staples landscape. Clorox (NYSE: CLX) has surged 24.91%, Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE: CL) jumped 20.62%, and Church & Dwight (NYSE: CHD) gained ... P&G Rallies Under New CEO but Lags Rivals, Faces Tariff Challenges

headline: SCHD: Still Think It's Dead Money?
summary: SCHD is benefiting from a rotation out of growth into value and dividend stocks, fueled by expectations of lower interest rates. Read why SCHD ETF is a Buy.

headline: Is Clorox (CLX) Now Offering Value After Recent Share Price Rebound?
summary: Wondering if Clorox is fairly priced after a bumpy few years, or if the current share price is quietly offering value that the market has not fully appreciated yet? The stock last closed at US$125.95, with returns of 6.9% over 7 days, 17.7% over 30 days and 24.9% year to date. Over longer periods, the 1-year, 3-year and 5-year returns stand at an 11.8% decline, 9.0% decline and 21.0% decline respectively. Recent headlines around Clorox have focused on how the company is repositioning its...

headline: Is Clorox’s (CLX) Margin Squeeze Reshaping Its Capital Return Playbook?
summary: In early February 2026, The Clorox Company reported past second-quarter results showing sales of US$1,673 million and net income of US$157 million, both slightly lower than a year earlier, alongside updates on its long-running share repurchase program. These figures highlight how Clorox is balancing softer demand and margin pressure with capital returns and the final stages of its ERP rollout and integration work. We’ll now explore how these mixed results, particularly the ongoing margin...
